info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 1:34PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berkshire County through 200 PM EDT... At 133 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sandisfield, or 11 miles southeast of Great Barrington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Otis, Sandisfield, New Marlborough, Monterey, South Sandisfield, North Green, Otis Wood Lanes, Konkapot, North Colebrook, New Boston, Algerie Four Corners, Bonny Rigg Corners, North Otis, Montville, Free Quarter, Roosterville, Hephzibah Heights, McClaveville, Southfield and West New Boston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
